010package imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.AffineFit2D;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017
018/**
019 * This class represents an affine transformation in 2D, which can be defined 
020 * by three pairs of corresponding points.
021 * It can be assumed that every instance of this class is indeed an affine mapping.
022 */
023public class AffineMapping2D extends ProjectiveMapping2D {
024
025        /**
026         * Creates an affine 2D mapping from two sequences of corresponding points.
027         * If 3 point pairs are specified, the mapping is exact, otherwise a
028         * minimum least-squares fit is calculated.
029         * @param P the source points
030         * @param Q the target points
031         * @return a new {@link AffineMapping2D} instance for the two point sets
032         */
033        public static AffineMapping2D fromPoints(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
034                if (P.length != Q.length) {
035                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("point sets P, Q must have the same size");
036                }
037                if (P.length < 3) {
038                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 point pairs are required");
039                }
040                if (P.length == 3) {
041                        // exact fit
042                        return fromPoints(P[0], P[1], P[2], Q[0], Q[1], Q[2]);
043                }
044                else {
045                        // minimum least-squares fit
046                        AffineFit2D fit = new AffineFit2D(P, Q);
047                        return new AffineMapping2D(fit.getTransformationMatrix());
048                }
049        }
050        
051        /**
052         * <p>
053         * Creates an affine mapping from 3 pairs of corresponding 2D points
054         * (p0, p1, p2) &rarr; (q0, q1, q2).
055         * The solution is found in closed form (see [1], Sec. 21.1.3, eq. 21.31).
056         * </p>
057         * <p>
058         * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
059         * </p>
060         * 
061         * @param p0 point 1 of source triangle A
062         * @param p1 point 2 of source triangle A
063         * @param p2 point 3 of source triangle A
064         * @param q0 point 1 of source triangle B
065         * @param q1 point 2 of source triangle B
066         * @param q2 point 3 of source triangle B
067         * @return a new {@link AffineMapping2D} instance
068         */
069        public static AffineMapping2D fromPoints(Pnt2d p0, Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2, Pnt2d q0, Pnt2d q1, Pnt2d q2) {
070                final double px0 = p0.getX(), px1 = p1.getX(), px2 = p2.getX();
071                final double py0 = p0.getY(), py1 = p1.getY(), py2 = p2.getY();
072                final double qx0 = q0.getX(), qx1 = q1.getX(), qx2 = q2.getX();
073                final double qy0 = q0.getY(), qy1 = q1.getY(), qy2 = q2.getY();
074
075                final double d = px0 * (py2 - py1) + px1 * (py0 - py2) + px2 * (py1 - py0); 
076                if (Arithmetic.isZero(d)) {
077                        throw new ArithmeticException("affine mapping is undefined (d=0)");
078                }
079                double a00 = (py0 * (qx1 - qx2) + py1 * (qx2 - qx0) + py2 * (qx0 - qx1)) / d;
080                double a01 = (px0 * (qx2 - qx1) + px1 * (qx0 - qx2) + px2 * (qx1 - qx0)) / d;
081                double a10 = (py0 * (qy1 - qy2) + py1 * (qy2 - qy0) + py2 * (qy0 - qy1)) / d;
082                double a11 = (px0 * (qy2 - qy1) + px1 * (qy0 - qy2) + px2 * (qy1 - qy0)) / d;
083                
084                double a02 = (px0*(py2*qx1-py1*qx2) + px1*(py0*qx2-py2*qx0) + px2*(py1*qx0-py0*qx1)) / d;
085                double a12 = (px0*(py2*qy1-py1*qy2) + px1*(py0*qy2-py2*qy0) + px2*(py1*qy0-py0*qy1)) / d;
086                
087                return new AffineMapping2D(a00, a01, a02, a10, a11, a12);
088        }
089        
090//      /**
091//       * Creates an affine mapping from an arbitrary 2D triangle A to another triangle B.
092//       * @param A the first triangle
093//       * @param B the second triangle
094//       * @return a new affine mapping
095//       * @deprecated
096//       */
097//      public static AffineMapping2D from3Points(Point[] A, Point[] B) {
098//              return AffineMapping2D.from3Points(A[0], A[1], A[2], B[0], B[1], B[2]);
099//      }
100        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
101        
102        /**
103         * Creates the identity mapping.
104         */
105        public AffineMapping2D() {
106                super();
107        }
108        
109        /**
110         * Creates a linear mapping from a transformation matrix A,
111         * which must be at least of size 2 x 3.
112         * The elements of A are copied into a 3x3 identity matrix.
113         * If A is larger than 2 x 3, the remaining elements are ignored.
114         * @param A a 2x3 (or larger) matrix
115         */
116        public AffineMapping2D(double[][] A) {
117                //super(A[0][0], A[0][1], A[0][2], A[1][0], A[1][1], A[1][2], 0, 0);
118                super(extractAffineMatrix(A));
119        }
120        
121        private static double[][] extractAffineMatrix(double[][] A) {
122                double[][] M = Matrix.idMatrix(3);
123                final int m = Math.min(2, A.length);    // max. 2 rows
124                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
125                        final int n = Math.min(3, A[i].length); // max. 3 columns
126                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
127                                M[i][j] = A[i][j];
128                        }
129                }
130                return M;
131        }
132
133        /**
134         * Creates an affine mapping from the specified matrix elements.
135         * @param a00 matrix element A_00
136         * @param a01 matrix element A_01
137         * @param a02 matrix element A_02
138         * @param a10 matrix element A_10
139         * @param a11 matrix element A_11
140         * @param a12 matrix element A_12
141         */
142        public AffineMapping2D (
143                        double a00, double a01, double a02, 
144                        double a10, double a11, double a12) {
145                super(a00, a01, a02, a10, a11, a12, 0, 0);
146        }
147
148        /**
149         * Creates a new affine mapping from an existing affine mapping.
150         * @param m an affine mapping
151         */
152        public AffineMapping2D(AffineMapping2D m) {
153                this(m.a00, m.a01, m.a02, m.a10, m.a11, m.a11);
154        }
155        
156        // ----------------------------------------------------------
157        
158        /** Deviation limit for checking 0 and 1 values. */
159        protected static double AffineTolerance = 1e-15;
160        
161        /**
162         * Checks if the given linear mapping could be affine, i.e. if the
163         * bottom row of its transformation matrix is (0, 0, 1). 
164         * Note that this is a necessary but not sufficient requirement.
165         * The threshold {@link AffineTolerance} is used in this check.
166         * @param map a linear mapping
167         * @return true if the mapping could be affine
168         */
169        public static boolean isAffine(LinearMapping2D map) {
170                if (Math.abs(map.a20) > AffineTolerance) return false;
171                if (Math.abs(map.a21) > AffineTolerance) return false;
172                if (Math.abs(map.a22 - 1.0) > AffineTolerance) return false;
173                return true;
174        }
175
176        /**
177         * Concatenates this mapping A with another affine mapping B and returns
178         * a new mapping C, such that C(x) = B(A(x)).
179         * @param B the second mapping
180         * @return the concatenated affine mapping
181         */
182        public AffineMapping2D concat(AffineMapping2D B) {      // use some super method instead?
183                double[][] C = Matrix.multiply(B.getTransformationMatrix(), this.getTransformationMatrix());
184                return new AffineMapping2D(C[0][0], C[0][1], C[0][2], C[1][0], C[1][1], C[1][2]);
185        }
186        
187        @Override       // more efficient than generic version
188        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d pnt) {
189                final double x = pnt.getX();
190                final double y = pnt.getY();
191                double x1 = (a00 * x + a01 * y + a02);
192                double y1 = (a10 * x + a11 * y + a12);
193                return PntDouble.from(x1, y1);
194        }
195
196        /**
197         * {@inheritDoc}
198         * Note that inverting an affine transformation always yields
199         * another affine transformation.
200         */
201        @Override
202        public AffineMapping2D getInverse() {
203                double det = a00 * a11 - a01 * a10;
204                double b00 = a11 / det;
205                double b01 = -a01 / det;
206                double b02 = (a01 * a12 - a02 * a11) / det;
207                double b10 = -a10 / det;
208                double b11 = a00 / det;
209                double b12 = (a02 * a10 - a00 * a12) / det;
210                return new AffineMapping2D(b00, b01, b02, b10, b11, b12);
211        }
212
213        /**
214         * {@inheritDoc}
215         * @return a new affine mapping
216         */
217        @Override
218        public AffineMapping2D duplicate() {
219                return new AffineMapping2D(this);
220        }
221
222        @Override
223        public double[][] getJacobian(Pnt2d xy) {
224                final double x = xy.getX();
225                final double y = xy.getY();
226                return new double[][]
227                        {{x, y, 0, 0, 1, 0},
228                         {0, 0, x, y, 0, 1}};
229        }
230        
231        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
232

251//              double[][] I = Matrix.multiply(A, ai);
252//              System.out.println("\ntest: should be the  identity matrix: = \n" + Matrix.toString(I));
253//

255//                      {{-2, 4, -3},

259//              System.out.println("an = \n" + Matrix.toString(am.getTransformationMatrix()));
260//      }
261
262}
